Key Match Events: Jackson Irvine scored the first goal in the 50th minute after Gurpreet Singh Sandhu failed to grab a cross from Martin Boyle
Jordan Bos scored the second goal in the 74th minute after a combination with Riley McGree
Pre-Game Insights: Playing against Australia, ranked 25 in the FIFA ranking, is always a tough battle
India knew it was also their moment of glory, a stepping stone towards achieving the dream of crossing swords with the best in the world
Post-Match Reflections: The large number of Indian fans present at the ground must have felt proud and encouraged by the fact that the Blue Tigers, though beaten, were not overwhelmed by their mighty rivals and chose to fight by looking into their eyes
India will play their next match in Group B against Uzbekistan on January 18 at the Ahmad bin Ali Stadium at 20:00 IST
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Indians could hardly keep Mathew Ryan busy under the Australia bar
The Indian defence remained the most overworked lot; their exhaustion was apparent as a couple of them slumped on the pitch when the referee blew the whistle for half-time
Others: The match was played at the Ahmad bin Ali Stadium on Saturday, January 13, 2024
Indian coach Igor Stimac kept an eagle-eyed watch on his wards
Lallianzuala Chhangte offered a quick prayer while going down on his knees
